questions.text: What is the name of Julia Roberts' character in "Pretty Woman"?
questions.explanation:
Vivian.

	Julia Roberts was born October 28, 1967 in Smyrna, GA.

questions.text: What is the Latin translation of "I came, I saw, I conquered"?
questions.explanation:
Veni, vidi, vici.

	Another popular Latin phrase is "Carpe diem" which means seize the day.

questions.text: Who does Danny DeVito play in "Twins"?
questions.explanation:
Vincent.

	Danny DeVito is 5' tall. He is also a vegetarian. He is married to Rhea Perlman, who played Carla on "Cheers".

questions.text: Spell the word that is used for cleaning a floor, and comes with attachments.
questions.explanation:
vacuum.

	Lee de Forest invented the first vacuum tube in 1906.

questions.text: Who did the music for the show "Green Acres"?
questions.explanation:
Vic Mizzy.

	Vic Mizzy also did music for "Addams Family".

questions.text: Which of the following is a small bird?
questions.explanation:
vireo.

	A vicuna is a kind of llama. A vole is a type of rodent.

questions.text: Who was the coach of the Green Bay Packers when they won the first two Superbowls?
questions.explanation:
Vince Lombardi.

	Vonta Leach is a fullback (as of the 2004 season). Vinny Ciurciu is a linebacker, for the Carolina Panthers (as of the 2004 season). Virgil Williams (as of 2004) is a safety for the Chicago Bears.

questions.text: What is a tool that is used in carpentry?
questions.explanation:
vice & vise.

	A vise is also used in metalworking.

questions.text: Which book was written by Jacqueline Susann?
questions.explanation:
Valley of the Dolls.

	Susann was born August 20, 1918 in Philadelphia, Penn. "Valley of the Lost" was written by Emily Rodda. "Valley of Fear" was written by Mary Stanton. "Valley of the Shadow" was written by Peter Tremayne.

Valens, Ritchie.

	Ritchie Valens was one of the singers who was tragically killed on February 3, 1959 when the plane he was in crashed near Mason City, Iowa.
